lines.line: Hello there. The name's Vanstrom Klause. How goes it stranger?
Quite well, thanks for asking. How about you?
Hmm, well, I am a little concerned about some friends of mine. They're in dire need of some assistance, but I'm at a loss as to how I can help them.
What friends are these?
It's a personal tragedy that I have yet to meet them in the flesh. But their exploits make mouth watering stories... The real meat and drink of high adventure and daring... So they say.
What does that mean exactly? I mean, I have some stories. I'm quite a hero myself, you may actually be talking about me?
They're a group of rebels fighting against the vampyres that rule over Morytania. They're known as the Myreque. Some people call them terrorists while others call them freedom fighters!
I see. And you want to help them?
Of course. I'm a big fan of their cause. I was hoping to supply them with some new weapons. Alas, I find that I'm rather lacking in ability when it comes to this kind of thing!
Well perhaps I could take these weapons to the Myreque. What do they need?
Really? You would help?
I was hoping to deliver some steel to them. A longsword, two shortswords, a dagger, a mace and a warhammer.
Though if you wish to do this, I'm afraid you'll need to acquire the weapons yourself. My efforts to procure them have been rather unsuccessful.
Right. Get some steel weapons and take them to the Myreque. Where can I find them?
The vampyres are always hunting them, so they keep themselves hidden. I hear the boatman in Mort'ton has dealings with them though.
Well I'd better get going then.
How wonderful! Perhaps the people of Morytania now have an additional hero that they can come to rely on?
What else do you know about the Myreque?
There's always some evil heel ready to grind the face of humanity into the dirt. Here in Morytania, it's the vampyres! They rule over the region with an iron fist, killing any who oppose them.
The Myreque are the only ones brave enough to stand up to them. They stay in the shadows though, lest the vampyres track them down!
No one knows for sure how many of them there are. The group hiding in Mort Myre supposedly has six members. There are whispers of more in other parts of Morytania though.
And this group in Mort Myre? They're who the weapons are for?
Yes, indeed! The Myreque are almost certainly able to handle themselves... But they need the tools to do it!
Remind me, what weapons do I need?
You've forgotten already? Ha! That's funny! But I do understand, my memory isn't what it was either!
I'd suggest a longsword, two shortswords, a dagger, a mace and a warhammer, all made of steel.
You'll need to obtain the weapons yourself. Fear not though! If you return to me here once you've found them, I'll be sure to give you a nice surprise in return for your help!
Where can I find this boatman?
I hear he lives in Mort'ton. You'll find the town south of here, through Mort Myre. It's a nasty place, but where isn't in Morytania?
Most of the town has supposedly fallen to some strange affliction. The boatman is apparently one of the few healthy people left!
And you say he's had dealings with the Myreque?
So I hear. There are many who sympathise with their movement. Rumour is that this boatman's been ferrying supplies to their hideout, somewhere in Mort Myre!
I'd better be off.
I wish I could help, but I'm busy at the moment.
Oh well, I'm sure someone will be along to help soon. Thanks for even considering it though.
Hello again. Any luck finding the Myreque?
Hello there friend.
Hello there. I'm guessing you're the boatman?
Well I am 'a' boatman. I don't know about 'the' boatman though. Why do you ask anyway?
I hear you have dealings with the Myreque. I was hoping to take some weapons to them.
Hmm, I'm sure I don't know what you're talking about.
Come on, I know you're in cahoots with them. It's important that I get these weapons to them.
Well... Okay, I may have done some work for them before. It's too dangerous now though. I'm sorry, I can't help you.
Oh come on, you can tell me!
I'm sorry, I just can't... They're watching us you know... Eyes everywhere!
Well, I guess they'll just die without weapons.
Hmm, you don't seem too concerned about their welfare. I'm glad I didn't tell you where they are. In any case, they're resourceful, they can look after themselves.
What's that supposed to mean?
They're resourceful folks, that's all I'm saying. The leader of their group, Veliaf, looks after them well.
Resourceful enough to get their own steel weapons?
Maybe they are... What do you care anyway? They've been up against it ever since they got started.
All of 'em have suffered more loss and heartache than you'll ever know. Now, leave me be!
What have they been up against?
You're clearly not from around here or you wouldn't be asking such foolish questions.
Drakan. That's what they've been up against.
Drakan?
Lord Lowerniel Drakan. Leader of the vampyres and ruler of Morytania. His reign over these lands means we all live in fear.
What kind of loss and heartache have they suffered?
The worst kind. Most have lost members of their family.
Take Sani Piliu for example. she was orphaned overnight when a vampyre went on the rampage. Imagine that, losing your entire family in one night. Terrible!
It sounds awful... Who is Sani Piliu?
She's the only female member of the Myreque. Her agility and light fingers have got them out of quite a few sticky situations.
If you don't tell me, their deaths are on your head!
There's death aplenty in this forsaken place... What do I care that some fool hardy vigilantes decided to go it alone against the Drakans?
Stupidity of youth is to blame. I won't carry it on my shoulders!
One man's vigilante is another man's freedom fighter!
Aye, you can see it from both sides I suppose. But many of us consider it fool hardy to fight for something we'll never get.
I remember a conversation I had with Polmafi, a scholar, such as he was. Even he agrees that the chances are slim.
Polmafi? Who's he?
Polmafi Ferdygris is one of the Myreque. He's a technical sort and advises on all sorts of things to Veliaf. He was a scholar before he became a renegade.
What do you know of the Drakans?
They're the family that leads the vampyres. They're the ones to whom the blood tithes are paid. Too much I have told you already!
Ignorance is better than these truths I tell you! I can pretend once more that I am a free man and some relief from this gloom can I feel again.
Be gone with you now and leave me with my dreams.
What kind of a man are you to say that you don't care?
Don't dare to judge me young fool... what do you know of the heartache I carry? I want to help them! I did help them! But my part is done now. To do any more is to risk death!
You're risking death either way. Better to risk it and help the cause, than to stand by and do nothing.
Hmmm. Very well, if you would take your chance to help these strangers, who am I to stop you?
So you'll help me? Will you take me to them?
No, I won't take you, but you can use my boat.
You'll be going through Mort Myre though, so I won't be letting you go unless you've got some defence against the ghasts.
I don't have anything which I can use against them.
Well return to me once you have.
I have this druid pouch! This turns the ghasts visible and I can kill them once I can see them.
Very well, you can go! But you'll need to bring me six wooden planks first.
What for?
The boat took some damage on my last trip. It needs repairing. There's also a bridge you'll need to cross later in your journey. It's rotten and will likely need repairs.
Three of the planks are for the boat and three are for the bridge. I suggest you bring some tools and steel nails along as well.
Here are some planks for you.
Right. You can take the boat. Just jump in when you're ready to leave.

Go as far north as you can and you'll arrive at the Hollows. Keep heading north on foot, over the rotten bridge, and you'll eventually reach an odd looking tree. That is where you'll find the Myreque.
I'll be back later.
Why do you say that this place is forsaken?
All of these lands are forsaken of Saradomin's kindness, only cold death from evil do we now feel.
Those lucky ones to the west of the Salve little realise their fate if the river should one day become tainted.
I'll give you some cash if you tell me.
You think you can buy me?
Err, no. I just want to compensate you for your trouble.
You keep your money and I'll keep my secrets.
I just want to help them, I think they need help.
Aye, everyone in these lands needs help. I'm sorry though, it's just not safe and it's not likely to get safer any time soon.
Look, I feel for them, I really do. They're fighting the good fight out there and unfortunately, some of them probably won't live through it.
Ivan in particular I feel sorry for. He's the youngest of their group and he's seen too few winters to be involved in such toil.
Then tell me how to find them. I can help them.
I support their cause. That doesn't mean I want to die for them though. I'm sorry, but I will not risk the wrath of the vampyres.
Okay, thanks.
Please. I need to know how to find the Myreque.
I'm sorry, but I can't help you. I guess you're all out of luck.
So, will you take me to the Myreque?
Can I ask you some more questions?
Sure you can.
Where am I meant to be going?

Take my boat as far north as you can and you'll arrive at the Hollows. Keep heading north on foot, over the rotten bridge, and you'll eventually reach an odd looking tree. That is where you'll find the Myreque.
Tell me more about the Myreque.
What do you want to know?
Why are they called the Myreque?
It's a name the locals gave them. It means 'hidden in the myre'. Nothing fancy, it's just because that's where they hide, in Mort Myre.
Tell me about the members of the Myreque.
Well you have Radigad Ponfit. He was a mercenary from Asgarnia but he joined up with the Myreque to settle some mysterious score with the Drakans.
Then there's Veliaf Hurtz, the leader of the group. He's been fighting the fight longer than any of them.
Next there's Ivan Strom. He's the youngest. I hear he's an aspiring priest. Not that there's much time for that around here.
You've also got Sani Piliu, the only female of the group. She's a bit of a shady one. I reckon she was a thief before the Myreque found her.
There's Harold Evans. Used to be part of some militia but was kicked out for being too hot-headed. Now he's the main fighter for the Myreque.
Finally, you have Polmafi Ferdygris. He's the brains of the operation in many ways. Believe it or not, he used to be a scholar.
And that's all of them?
In Mort Myre it is. I sometimes hear rumour of more groups hidden in other parts of Morytania. Who knows if that's true though.
Tell me about the Drakans.
They're the family of vampyres that rules all of Morytania. Lowerniel Drakan is the head of the family. Every bit of misery in this place is caused by him.
No one out here ever sees the Drakans, but their presence is always felt. Their castle towers over all of the region. A constant reminder of their tyranny.
Tell me about yourself.
I'm just a humble boatman. Cyreg Paddlehorn is my name. Like most of the Paddlehorns before me, I make my living by tacking the swamps of Mort Myre.
Hey. What're you doin' here?
I've come to help the Myreque. I've brought weapons.
It don't look like you have suitable weapons to me! Get out of here you fake!
Okay, I see ya got some weapons. But here's da thing. These guys out here, they don't wanna be found. They paid me good money to keep em hidden.
Now, you seems all sincered up to me... It's choking me up right here. But hey, I's godda do my job or da kids don't get fed!
But I just want to deliver these weapons.
Okay, I's got an idea. Say I asks you a few questions and you answer them all correct and so on... Well that'd make me trust you's. How's dat sound?
Sounds fine to me... Go ahead, shoot!
Hey... Don't tempt me! You's dicing wiv death here my friend!
Okay, question. Name the only female member of the Myreque.
Sani Piliu.
Santi Peliou.
Sani Peridou.
Sandi Pherimou.
I don't know.
Okay, question. Who is the youngest member of the Myreque?
Ivan Strom.
Veliaf Hurtz.
Radigad Ponfit.
Okay, question. Who is the leader of the Myreque in Mort Myre?
Harold Evans.
Okay, question. Which member of the Myreque was originally a scholar?
Polmafi Ferdygris.
Okay, question. What is the name of the boatman who helps the Myreque?
Geof Paddleman.
Cyreg Paddlebone.
Gyrec Paddlehorn.
Cyreg Paddlehorn.
Okay, question. What vampyre family rules over Morytania?
Drunken.
Drakan.
Draynor.
Praymore.
Okay, interesting answer. That's the first question done.
An interesting response. That's the second question answered.
Hmm. Very interesting. That's the third question answered.
I'm sorry but you got no questions correct! Go on get outta here...
I'm sorry but you only got one question correct! Go on get outta here...
I'm sorry but you only got two questions correct! Go on get outta here...
Okay, I believes ya... You can go on in. Head through the doors behind the tree. Once you's in, take the first cave on the right.
I don't have to answer to you!
You do if you know what's good for you!
No reason!
Come on... Speak up! I may be able to help you. However, yous gotta know that your tresspassing and that by rights I should slap your around a bit. You know, just like as a warning.
I'm lost. Can you show me the way out?
You got yourself here... Now get yourself out... Quickly if I were you.
I have to go.
Sure... Be on your way stranger.
Back again? You ain't getting in 'till you answer my questions.
Well let's hear them then.
Okay, first question...
Wat ya still doing out here? Head through the doors behind the tree. Once you's in, take the first cave on the right.
Hey! Who are you and why are you here?
It's okay. I'm a friend. I'm here to deliver some weapons to you.
Weapons? You'd better talk to Veliaf then. I'll be keeping an eye on you though, so don't go trying anything.
I'm keeping my eye on you. Nothing personal. We just need to be careful with newcomers. Anyway, Veliaf will want to speak to you.
Greetings! Good to see some new blood. You'd better speak with Veliaf. He's in charge here.
Hello there. Here to help the cause are you? Speak to Veliaf. He'll sort you out.
Hi there. You're new here aren't you? You'd best go and talk with Veliaf.
Oh... Hello. Sorry, but I'm not sure if I'm supposed to be talking to you. You'd better speak to Veliaf.
Hello there.
You... I saw you come in. Harold didn't kill you though so I'm guessing you're no enemy. Who are you?
I'm. Don't worry, I'm a friend. I was asked to bring you some weapons.
It's true that we could do with some supplies. Thank you for bringing them here. I'll have a proper look over them in a moment but there's something I must finish first.
Feel free to introduce yourself to the others in the meantime.
Ah, well met. We'll discuss those weapons shortly. I need to finish something first though. Feel free to introduce yourself to the others in the meantime.
Hello there. Forgive me if I seem cautious of you. We just need to be careful with newcomers.
It's fine. Do you mind if I ask a few questions?
Hello there. What can I do for you?
I'd like to ask a few questions if that's okay?
Sure. I'll do my best to answer them.
What's your job here?
Cheating death seems to be my main role. I'm the main fighter for the group so I'm always in the thick of it. It's gone okay for me so far though.
What can you tell me about this group?
We're a good team, though many of the others haven't had any proper training before. I used to be in a militia so I've been trying to share my knowledge as best I can.
In most cases we end up having to improvise though. Thankfully, this lot are good at that. Ivan over there, he saved our bacon in a recent run in with some juves.
Juves? What are they?
Juveniles, the lowest form of vampyre. We come across them quite often around here. They may be the weakest vampyres but they're still very dangerous.
They're stronger and faster than many well trained soldiers, and twice as bloodthirsty.
What's your grasp of the situation?
The situation is grave. It would be dangerous to think differently.
We're really up against it, but we have no choice. This is a battle for our very existence and we need to employ any tactics to achieve our goal.
Have you heard any rumours?
Yes, I hear them all the time. I don't pay any attention to them though.
Ah, I see you've introduced yourself to Veliaf. Are you planning to join the fray against the Drakans?
Maybe. I'd like to ask a few questions if that's okay?
Hello again! How can I be of service to you?
I'd like to ask you few questions.
Sure, go ahead. I'll answer as best I can.

I help with anything I can. I used to be a mercenary before joining the Myreque so I know my way around a blade. I've relied on Veliaf's sword arm many a time. I like to think that he can rely on mine.
What can you tell me about the Myreque?
We're the only resistance against the vampyres. We're seriously outnumbered though. Veliaf doesn't like to hear us saying 'hopeless' but that's our situation at the minute.
What're your plans for the future?
That's more a question for Veliaf. Ultimately though, our goal is to rid Morytania of the vampyres so that we might reclaim our right to exist.
For me personally, I hope that more people will join our ranks soon. Strengh comes in numbers after all.
I have. Something you might find interesting is that Safalaan Hallow, the leader of another Myreque group, has apparently managed to sneak one of his people into the vampyre capital, Darkmeyer.
I'm not sure how true that is. It would be great though!
Ah, I see you've introduced yourself to Veliaf. Now, what can I do for you?
Do you mind if I ask a few questions?
Salutations! How are you?
Fine thanks. I'd like to ask a few questions if that's okay?
Not at all. I'm sure I'll be able to help.
What are you doing here?
I'm a key advisor to Veliaf. He seeks my council on many issues before we engage the enemy. Not that we do that very often. Our foes heavily outnumber us.
We don't give up though. After all, all that is required for evil to survive is for good people to do nothing.
Well there's multiple groups of us. Even we don't know exactly how many. The less we know about our allies, the less we can reveal to the vampyres if captured.
Veliaf leads this group. We operate throughout Mort Myre and the surrounding villages. He reports to Calsidiu who is the head of our resistance.
What do you know about Morytania?
All the land on this side of the Salve is known as Morytania. Humans and vampyres are the main occupants of the region, though other races also live out here.
The humans here live like cattle with the vampyres taking regular blood tithes to keep themselves fed. All in all, it's a dire place. Though we hope to change that.
Yes, I hear them all the time. They're neither correct or even all that interesting though.
Hello. Very nice to meet you! The name's Sani Piliu. What's yours?
I'm. Nice to meet you Sani.
The pleasure's all mine! I've got a good feeling about you. I reckon you're going to do great things for us! You have a powerful aura. Sorry, that must seem really strange.
Well, perhaps a little. It's nice of you to say so in any case though. I'd like to ask a few questions if that's okay?
Oh, hello. Nice to see you again! How's things?
Fine thanks. Do you mind if I ask a few questions?
Sure, go ahead. I'll answer as best I can.
Tell me a bit about yourself.
There's not much to tell really. I was nine years old when my family was ripped to pieces by a vampyre.
One moment I was a happy member of a loving family, the next I was an orphan living a hand to mouth existence.
Somehow I managed to get by, eking out a living wherever I could. People took pity on me and I earnt food by helping them out.
I quickly found I had a very useful set of skills and there were plenty of people willing to pay for them.

I bumped into Veliaf in Canifis. He saw that I would be an asset to the Myreque and invited me to join. I said yes of course. I couldn't turn down the chance to fight against those who took away my family.

Well Veliaf is the leader of our group. We're not the only ones in Morytania though. Veliaf reports to someone called Calsidiu who's in charge of all the Myreque. I've never met any of the others though.
Our hope is to one day bring an end to the reign of Lowerniel Drakan and his vampyres.
For now though, we're just trying to find any weaknesses we can take advantage of. We need to know how to kill them before we take the war to them!
You make it sound easy!
With determination you can achieve great things. However, Veliaf always tells us not to underestimate the enemy. I've made that mistake before. I won't be making it again.
What's going on in Morytania?

The entire region is ruled over by Lowerniel Drakan and his family. Everyone living here must pay blood tithes to the vampyres. The tithes keep the vampyres fed and ensure that people are too weak to oppose them.
That's where we come in. We won't just offer our family members to the Drakans as a weekly snack. We're going to fight back!
Is this your main camp?
It's our only camp! At least, for our group. I know there's more Myreque in other parts of Morytania but I don't know exactly where.
Hi there. Veliaf said that I should introduce myself to everyone.
Okay. Well my name is Ivan. It's nice to meet you.
Would you mind if I asked you a few questions?
Oh, hello again. How are you?
Fine thanks. Would you mind if I asked you a few questions?
That's fine. I don't know how much I can help though.
Me personally? I shouldn't be here really. I'm training to be a priest and I was meant to travel to Paterdomus to learn from Drezel. The trip's too dangerous at the moment though.
Is it really important for you to train as a priest? I'd have thought there'd be more pressing issues.
Veliaf thinks it would be useful to have a priest to advise him. I think he also wants me further away from harm until I'm more experienced.
We're the only ones brave enough to put up a fight against the Drakans. I'm proud to be one of them.
I do worry that I might let the others down though. I'm not as skilled as they are.
It's a lost land. The evil Drakan family rule all of the region. People cling to each other in fear when the blood tithes are to be paid. It's horrible!
It won't be like this forever though. The Myreque will bring light back to this dark place.
Sorry, but I haven't heard anything notable recently.
Well met. I see you've introduced yourself to everyone. Shall we discuss those weapons now? Or was there something else you wanted to talk about?
Let's talk about the weapons.
Let's see what you have for us.
These weapons look great! Many thanks.
What the...
Vampyre!
It's Vanstrom!
Wait... What?
Well done adventurer! You led me right to them. The little dears are going to wonder which side you're on!
The Drakans have been wanting you lot dealt with for a while now. We wouldn't want to disappoint them, would we?
We're dead!
Quite right.
No!
Sorry Harold, you too!
And now... A little gift for the rest of you.
Ah. I'm afraid you don't have suitable weapons for us. Sorry friend.
What weapons do you need?
Well we all have our own specialisms. We could do with a longsword, two shortswords, a dagger, a mace and a warhammer, all made from steel.
Okay. I'll come back once I have them.
So you're the leader of this group?
That's right. I can't say I particularly asked for it. The others look up to me though, so they decided I was the best man for the job.
Can you tell me about your organisation?
Well I wouldn't say we're an organisation. We're really not that organised.
Anyway though, we're a group of Myreque freedom fighters. We're dedicated to mounting a resistance against the Drakan family and their vampyre kin.
What can you tell me about Morytania?
If legend is to be believed, it was once a beautiful place. But then Lowerniel Drakan and his vampyres arrived.
Who is Lowerniel Drakan?
Lowerniel Vergidiyad Drakan is his full name. He's the vampyre that heads up the Drakan family. Helped by his brother Ranis and his sister Vanescula, he rules over all of Morytania.
You sound very bitter.
So would you if you lost everyone dear to you at the hands of such monsters.
What are your plans for the future?
At the moment we're maintaining a low profile here at our hideout. We were recently spotted while out on a scouting mission so we're playing it safe and lying low.
Looking further ahead, we need to build more support if we have any hope of taking on the vampyres. We also need to learn more about their weaknesses, so we can take advantage of them.
Sani... Harold... That murderer killed them!
I'm so sorry. This is all my fault.
I don't understand though. He said you led him here. How?
He was the one that asked me to bring the weapons to you. He looked like a human though.
I'm sorry friend, but he clearly took advantage of you. Vampyres can shapeshift to look like humans. Someone from around here might have realised. You were not to know though.
No. I'm still responsible though.
The burden of what happened here is for your conscience to bear. That said, you managed to kill that pet of his. We might all be dead if not for you.
I imagine you now see why we fight for our freedom.
Yes. I think I understand. Is there anything I can do to help now? I first met Vanstrom in Canifis. I could go back and see if he's still there?
I suspect he will have moved on now. You're welcome to try though. I know a shortcut that you might find useful.
If you head back into the main cave and go north you'll reach a wall. There's a hidden door in that wall that leads right into the basement of the Hair of the Dog Tavern.
That's very useful. Thanks.
Once you are done, I'd appreciate you coming back here to discuss a few things. You held your own against that creature. We could use someone like you.
Need something?
I want to join your organisation.
Well we could definitely use someone like you. You should go and see if Vanstrom is still in Canifis though. Come back once you're done, and we'll talk.
What do you plan to do now?
We won't be able to stay here now that Vanstrom knows where we've been hiding. We have some time though. He'll expect that we're all dead. We'll use that time to form a plan of action.
How do I get out of here again?
That monster! He killed them! We'll make them all pay!
This is a dark day for the Myreque.
I'm so sorry for your loss.
Don't worry. No one blames you. You were tricked and that's that. It serves no useful purpose to blame any of ourselves for this.
Thank Saradomin you managed to kill that awful beast! I just wish we could have done more.
I'm so sorry for your loss. If there's anything I can do, please let me know.
I will. Thank you.
Hello friend. What can I do for you?
Oh, sorry. I thought you were someone else.
Who did you think I was?
I thought you were that dirty murderer Vanstrom.
Woah! It sounds like you've got a score to settle!
I definitely have!

characters.name: Curpile Fyod
characters.description: Middle-aged male, working-class British accent, gruff and officious tone, a heavy-handed guard who takes his job seriously to provide for his family.

characters.name: Cyreg Paddlehorn
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, tall and imposing with a guilt-ridden tone, a boatman who ferries people across the swamp and regrets past mistakes.

characters.name: Harold Evans
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, stoic and determined tone, a tough fighter who serves as the Myreque's main combatant and bears the brunt of danger.

characters.name: Ivan Strom
characters.description: Young adult male, British accent, earnest and devout tone, an aspiring priest who joined the resistance after vampyres killed his parents.

characters.name: Polmafi Ferdygris
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, thoughtful and measured scholarly tone, an intellectual advisor who looks more like a librarian than a fighter.

characters.name: Radigad Ponfit
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, quick-tempered and vengeful tone, an agile mercenary fighter from Asgarnia who burns with hatred for vampyres.

characters.name: Sani Piliu
characters.description: Young adult female, British accent, fierce and determined tone, a rogue driven by vengeance after vampyres killed her family when she was nine.

characters.name: Stranger
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, friendly and curious tone, an unassuming traveler who seems interested in local troubles.

characters.name: Vanstrom Klause
characters.description: Ancient male vampyre, Eastern European accent, sinister and menacing tone, a ruthless murderer who delights in terrorizing the resistance and hunting humans.

characters.name: Veliaf Hurtz
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, bold and commanding tone, a devout Saradominist and resourceful leader of the Myreque resistance dedicated to defeating vampyres.
